revised_title: The Mechanism of Water Loss in Insects
tldr: The author conducted experiments to determine the site and mechanism of water loss in insects, specifically mealworms. They found that insects primarily lose water through their spiracles, and that the rate of water loss increases when the spiracles are open. The author also discovered that the water loss is affected by the composition of the air surrounding the insect, with certain gas mixtures causing insects to keep their spiracles permanently open.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Insect Physiology
